#  Generated from FHIR 4.0.1-9346c8cc45, SMART Health IT.

import os
import io
import unittest
import json
from fhirclient.models import slot
from fhirclient.models.fhirdate import FHIRDate
from fhirclient.models.fhirdatetime import FHIRDateTime
from fhirclient.models.fhirinstant import FHIRInstant
from fhirclient.models.fhirtime import FHIRTime


class SlotTests(unittest.TestCase):
    def instantiate_from(self, filename):
        datadir = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), '..', 'data', 'examples')
        with io.open(os.path.join(datadir, filename), 'r', encoding='utf-8') as handle:
            js = json.load(handle)
            self.assertEqual("Slot", js["resourceType"])
        return slot.Slot(js)
    
    def testSlot1(self):
        inst = self.instantiate_from("slot-example.json")
        self.assertIsNotNone(inst, "Must have instantiated a Slot instance")
        self.implSlot1(inst)
        
        js = inst.as_json()
        self.assertEqual("Slot", js["resourceType"])
        inst2 = slot.Slot(js)
        self.implSlot1(inst2)
    
    def implSlot1(self, inst):
        self.assertEqual(inst.appointmentType.coding[0].code, "WALKIN")
        self.assertEqual(inst.appointmentType.coding[0].display, "A previously unscheduled walk-in visit")
        self.assertEqual(inst.appointmentType.coding[0].system, "http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0276")
        self.assertEqual(inst.comment, "Assessments should be performed before requesting appointments in this slot.")
        self.assertEqual(inst.end.datetime, FHIRInstant("2013-12-25T09:30:00Z").datetime)
        self.assertEqual(inst.end.as_json(), "2013-12-25T09:30:00Z")
        self.assertEqual(inst.id, "example")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].code, "HTEST")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].display, "test health data")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].system, "http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ActReason")
        self.assertEqual(inst.serviceCategory[0].coding[0].code, "17")
        self.assertEqual(inst.serviceCategory[0].coding[0].display, "General Practice")
        self.assertEqual(inst.serviceType[0].coding[0].code, "57")
        self.assertEqual(inst.serviceType[0].coding[0].display, "Immunization")
        self.assertEqual(inst.specialty[0].coding[0].code, "408480009")
        self.assertEqual(inst.specialty[0].coding[0].display, "Clinical immunology")
        self.assertEqual(inst.start.datetime, FHIRInstant("2013-12-25T09:15:00Z").datetime)
        self.assertEqual(inst.start.as_json(), "2013-12-25T09:15:00Z")
        self.assertEqual(inst.status, "free")
        self.assertEqual(inst.text.status, "generated")
    
    def testSlot2(self):
        inst = self.instantiate_from("slot-example-busy.json")
        self.assertIsNotNone(inst, "Must have instantiated a Slot instance")
        self.implSlot2(inst)
        
        js = inst.as_json()
        self.assertEqual("Slot", js["resourceType"])
        inst2 = slot.Slot(js)
        self.implSlot2(inst2)
    
    def implSlot2(self, inst):
        self.assertEqual(inst.comment, "Assessments should be performed before requesting appointments in this slot.")
        self.assertEqual(inst.end.datetime, FHIRInstant("2013-12-25T09:15:00Z").datetime)
        self.assertEqual(inst.end.as_json(), "2013-12-25T09:15:00Z")
        self.assertEqual(inst.id, "1")
        self.assertEqual(inst.identifier[0].system, "http://example.org/identifiers/slots")
        self.assertEqual(inst.identifier[0].value, "123132")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].code, "HTEST")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].display, "test health data")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].system, "http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ActReason")
        self.assertTrue(inst.overbooked)
        self.assertEqual(inst.serviceCategory[0].coding[0].code, "17")
        self.assertEqual(inst.serviceCategory[0].coding[0].display, "General Practice")
        self.assertEqual(inst.start.datetime, FHIRInstant("2013-12-25T09:00:00Z").datetime)
        self.assertEqual(inst.start.as_json(), "2013-12-25T09:00:00Z")
        self.assertEqual(inst.status, "busy")
        self.assertEqual(inst.text.status, "generated")
    
    def testSlot3(self):
        inst = self.instantiate_from("slot-example-unavailable.json")
        self.assertIsNotNone(inst, "Must have instantiated a Slot instance")
        self.implSlot3(inst)
        
        js = inst.as_json()
        self.assertEqual("Slot", js["resourceType"])
        inst2 = slot.Slot(js)
        self.implSlot3(inst2)
    
    def implSlot3(self, inst):
        self.assertEqual(inst.comment, "Dr Careful is out of the office")
        self.assertEqual(inst.end.datetime, FHIRInstant("2013-12-25T09:45:00Z").datetime)
        self.assertEqual(inst.end.as_json(), "2013-12-25T09:45:00Z")
        self.assertEqual(inst.id, "3")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].code, "HTEST")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].display, "test health data")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].system, "http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ActReason")
        self.assertEqual(inst.serviceCategory[0].coding[0].code, "17")
        self.assertEqual(inst.serviceCategory[0].coding[0].display, "General Practice")
        self.assertEqual(inst.start.datetime, FHIRInstant("2013-12-25T09:30:00Z").datetime)
        self.assertEqual(inst.start.as_json(), "2013-12-25T09:30:00Z")
        self.assertEqual(inst.status, "busy-unavailable")
        self.assertEqual(inst.text.status, "generated")
    
    def testSlot4(self):
        inst = self.instantiate_from("slot-example-tentative.json")
        self.assertIsNotNone(inst, "Must have instantiated a Slot instance")
        self.implSlot4(inst)
        
        js = inst.as_json()
        self.assertEqual("Slot", js["resourceType"])
        inst2 = slot.Slot(js)
        self.implSlot4(inst2)
    
    def implSlot4(self, inst):
        self.assertEqual(inst.comment, "Dr Careful is out of the office")
        self.assertEqual(inst.end.datetime, FHIRInstant("2013-12-25T10:00:00Z").datetime)
        self.assertEqual(inst.end.as_json(), "2013-12-25T10:00:00Z")
        self.assertEqual(inst.id, "2")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].code, "HTEST")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].display, "test health data")
        self.assertEqual(inst.meta.tag[0].system, "http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-ActReason")
        self.assertEqual(inst.serviceCategory[0].coding[0].code, "17")
        self.assertEqual(inst.serviceCategory[0].coding[0].display, "General Practice")
        self.assertEqual(inst.start.datetime, FHIRInstant("2013-12-25T09:45:00Z").datetime)
        self.assertEqual(inst.start.as_json(), "2013-12-25T09:45:00Z")
        self.assertEqual(inst.status, "busy-tentative")
        self.assertEqual(inst.text.status, "generated")

# Generated from FHIR 4.0.1-9346c8cc45 (http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Slot).
# 2024, SMART Health IT.


from . import domainresource

class Slot(domainresource.DomainResource):
    """ A slot of time on a schedule that may be available for booking appointments.
    """
    
    resource_type = "Slot"
    
    def __init__(self, jsondict=None, strict=True):
        """ Initialize all valid properties.
        
        :raises: FHIRValidationError on validation errors, unless strict is False
        :param dict jsondict: A JSON dictionary to use for initialization
        :param bool strict: If True (the default), invalid variables will raise a TypeError
        """
        
        self.appointmentType = None
        """ The style of appointment or patient that may be booked in the slot
        (not service type).
        Type `CodeableConcept` (represented as `dict` in JSON). """
        
        self.comment = None
        """ Comments on the slot to describe any extended information. Such as
        custom constraints on the slot.
        Type `str`. """
        
        self.end = None
        """ Date/Time that the slot is to conclude.
        Type `FHIRInstant` (represented as `str` in JSON). """
        
        self.identifier = None
        """ External Ids for this item.
        List of `Identifier` items (represented as `dict` in JSON). """
        
        self.overbooked = None
        """ This slot has already been overbooked, appointments are unlikely to
        be accepted for this time.
        Type `bool`. """
        
        self.schedule = None
        """ The schedule resource that this slot defines an interval of status
        information.
        Type `FHIRReference` (represented as `dict` in JSON). """
        
        self.serviceCategory = None
        """ A broad categorization of the service that is to be performed
        during this appointment.
        List of `CodeableConcept` items (represented as `dict` in JSON). """
        
        self.serviceType = None
        """ The type of appointments that can be booked into this slot (ideally
        this would be an identifiable service - which is at a location,
        rather than the location itself). If provided then this overrides
        the value provided on the availability resource.
        List of `CodeableConcept` items (represented as `dict` in JSON). """
        
        self.specialty = None
        """ The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform
        the service requested in this appointment.
        List of `CodeableConcept` items (represented as `dict` in JSON). """
        
        self.start = None
        """ Date/Time that the slot is to begin.
        Type `FHIRInstant` (represented as `str` in JSON). """
        
        self.status = None
        """ busy | free | busy-unavailable | busy-tentative | entered-in-error.
        Type `str`. """
        
        super(Slot, self).__init__(jsondict=jsondict, strict=strict)
    
    def elementProperties(self):
        js = super(Slot, self).elementProperties()
        js.extend([
            ("appointmentType", "appointmentType", codeableconcept.CodeableConcept, False, None, False),
            ("comment", "comment", str, False, None, False),
            ("end", "end", fhirinstant.FHIRInstant, False, None, True),
            ("identifier", "identifier", identifier.Identifier, True, None, False),
            ("overbooked", "overbooked", bool, False, None, False),
            ("schedule", "schedule", fhirreference.FHIRReference, False, None, True),
            ("serviceCategory", "serviceCategory", codeableconcept.CodeableConcept, True, None, False),
            ("serviceType", "serviceType", codeableconcept.CodeableConcept, True, None, False),
            ("specialty", "specialty", codeableconcept.CodeableConcept, True, None, False),
            ("start", "start", fhirinstant.FHIRInstant, False, None, True),
            ("status", "status", str, False, None, True),
        ])
        return js

from . import fhirinstant

"""Facilitate working with FHIR time fields."""
# 2024, SMART Health IT.

import datetime
import re
from typing import Any, Union

from .fhirdate import FHIRDate


# This inherits from FHIRDate as a matter of backwards compatibility.
# (in case anyone was doing isinstance(obj, FHIRDate))
# Next time we bump the major version, we can stop that and also drop the
# backwards-compatible 'date' alias. R4-QUIRK

class FHIRInstant(FHIRDate):
    """
    A convenience class for working with FHIR instants in Python.

    http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#instant

    Converting to a Python representation does require some compromises:
    - FHIR allows arbitrary sub-second precision, but Python only holds microseconds.
    - Leap seconds (:60) will be changed to the 59th second (:59) because Python's time classes
      do not support leap seconds.

    If such compromise is not useful for you, avoid using the `date`, `datetime`, or `isostring`
    properties and just use the `as_json()` method in order to work with the original,
    exact string.

    Public properties:
    - `datetime`: datetime.datetime representing the JSON value (aware only)
    - `date`: backwards-compatibility alias for `datetime`
    - `isostring`: an ISO 8601 string version of the above Python object

    Public methods:
    - `as_json`: returns the original JSON used to construct the instance
    """

    def __init__(self, jsonval: Union[str, None] = None):
        self.datetime: Union[datetime.datetime, None] = None
        super().__init__(jsonval)

    ##################################
    # Private properties and methods #
    ##################################

    # Pulled from spec for instant
    _REGEX = re.compile(r"([0-9]([0-9]([0-9][1-9]|[1-9]0)|[1-9]00)|[1-9]000)-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|3[0-1])T([01][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]:([0-5][0-9]|60)(\.[0-9]+)?(Z|(\+|-)((0[0-9]|1[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]|14:00))")
    _FIELD = "datetime"

    @staticmethod
    def _from_string(value: str) -> Any:
        return FHIRDate._parse_datetime(value)

from . import resource

class DomainResource(resource.Resource):
    """ A resource with narrative, extensions, and contained resources.
    
    A resource that includes narrative, extensions, and contained resources.
    """
    
    resource_type = "DomainResource"
    
    def __init__(self, jsondict=None, strict=True):
        """ Initialize all valid properties.
        
        :raises: FHIRValidationError on validation errors, unless strict is False
        :param dict jsondict: A JSON dictionary to use for initialization
        :param bool strict: If True (the default), invalid variables will raise a TypeError
        """
        
        self.contained = None
        """ Contained, inline Resources.
        List of `Resource` items (represented as `dict` in JSON). """
        
        self.extension = None
        """ Additional content defined by implementations.
        List of `Extension` items (represented as `dict` in JSON). """
        
        self.modifierExtension = None
        """ Extensions that cannot be ignored.
        List of `Extension` items (represented as `dict` in JSON). """
        
        self.text = None
        """ Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.
        Type `Narrative` (represented as `dict` in JSON). """
        
        super(DomainResource, self).__init__(jsondict=jsondict, strict=strict)
    
    def elementProperties(self):
        js = super(DomainResource, self).elementProperties()
        js.extend([
            ("contained", "contained", resource.Resource, True, None, False),
            ("extension", "extension", extension.Extension, True, None, False),
            ("modifierExtension", "modifierExtension", extension.Extension, True, None, False),
            ("text", "text", narrative.Narrative, False, None, False),
        ])
        return js

Initialize all valid properties for the Slot instance, which represents a time slot available for booking appointments. 

Parameters:
- jsondict (dict, optional): A JSON dictionary containing values to initialize the Slot properties. If not provided, all properties are set to None.
- strict (bool, optional): If True (default), raises a FHIRValidationError on validation errors; if False, invalid variables will not raise an error.

Attributes:
- appointmentType (CodeableConcept): Type of appointment or patient that may be booked.
- comment (str): Additional comments about the slot.
- end (FHIRInstant): Date and time when the slot ends.
- identifier (list of Identifier): External IDs for the slot.
- overbooked (bool): Indicates if the slot is overbooked.
- schedule (FHIRReference): Reference to the schedule this slot belongs to.
- serviceCategory (list of CodeableConcept): Broad categorization of the service.
- serviceType (list of CodeableConcept): Identifiable service type for appointments.
- specialty (list of CodeableConcept): Required specialty for the requested service.
- start (FHIRInstant): Date and time when the slot begins.
- status (str): Current status of the slot (e.g., busy, free).

Notes:
This class extends the DomainResource class, using its initialization method to populate common properties. The attributes are set to their respective types as defined in the FHIR specifications, facilitating adherence to health information standards.

FHIRDate.__init__.code:
def __init__(self, jsonval: Union[str, None]=None):
        """Initialize a FHIRDate instance to facilitate working with FHIR-compliant date strings.

Parameters:
- jsonval (Union[str, None]): A FHIR-compliant date string (in ISO 8601 format) or None. If provided, it must be a string that matches the expected FHIR date format as validated by the class-level regex constant `_REGEX`. 

Raises:
- TypeError: If `jsonval` is not a string when provided.
- ValueError: If `jsonval` does not match the expected date format.

Attributes:
- date (Union[datetime.date, datetime.datetime, datetime.time, None]): Represents the parsed date from `jsonval` or None if no valid date is provided.
- origval (Union[str, None]): Stores the original input string `jsonval` for reference when generating JSON outputs.

The class relies on the `_REGEX` constant for format validation and `_from_string` method for parsing the FHIR date string into a Python date object. If `jsonval` is a valid FHIR date string, it is converted and stored in the `date` attribute; otherwise, the instance is constructed with `None` values."""
        self.date: Union[datetime.date, datetime.datetime, datetime.time, None] = None
        if jsonval is not None:
            if not isinstance(jsonval, str):
                raise TypeError('Expecting string when initializing {}, but got {}'.format(type(self), type(jsonval)))
            if not self._REGEX.fullmatch(jsonval):
                raise ValueError('does not match expected format')
            self.date = self._from_string(jsonval)
        self.origval: Union[str, None] = jsonval

Initialize a FHIRDate instance to facilitate working with FHIR-compliant date strings.

Parameters:
- jsonval (Union[str, None]): A FHIR-compliant date string (in ISO 8601 format) or None. If provided, it must be a string that matches the expected FHIR date format as validated by the class-level regex constant `_REGEX`. 

Raises:
- TypeError: If `jsonval` is not a string when provided.
- ValueError: If `jsonval` does not match the expected date format.

Attributes:
- date (Union[datetime.date, datetime.datetime, datetime.time, None]): Represents the parsed date from `jsonval` or None if no valid date is provided.
- origval (Union[str, None]): Stores the original input string `jsonval` for reference when generating JSON outputs.

The class relies on the `_REGEX` constant for format validation and `_from_string` method for parsing the FHIR date string into a Python date object. If `jsonval` is a valid FHIR date string, it is converted and stored in the `date` attribute; otherwise, the instance is constructed with `None` values.

FHIRDate.__setattr__.code:
def __setattr__(self, prop, value):
        """Sets attributes for the FHIRDate instance, with special handling for the `date` property. 

Parameters:
- `prop`: The name of the attribute to set.
- `value`: The value to assign to the specified attribute.

If the attribute being set is either 'date' or the internal `_FIELD` constant (which is also set to 'date'), the method clears the `origval` attribute and ensures synchronization between the `date` property and the internal representation of that property. For all other attributes, it sets them normally.

This method maintains the integrity of the date field within the FHIRDate class and ensures that changes to the date representation are accurately reflected without retaining the original JSON value used for initialization."""
        if prop in {'date', self._FIELD}:
            self.origval = None
            object.__setattr__(self, self._FIELD, value)
            object.__setattr__(self, 'date', value)
        else:
            object.__setattr__(self, prop, value)

Sets attributes for the FHIRDate instance, with special handling for the `date` property. 

Parameters:
- `prop`: The name of the attribute to set.
- `value`: The value to assign to the specified attribute.

If the attribute being set is either 'date' or the internal `_FIELD` constant (which is also set to 'date'), the method clears the `origval` attribute and ensures synchronization between the `date` property and the internal representation of that property. For all other attributes, it sets them normally.

This method maintains the integrity of the date field within the FHIRDate class and ensures that changes to the date representation are accurately reflected without retaining the original JSON value used for initialization.

FHIRDate.as_json.docstring: Returns the original JSON string used to create the FHIRDate instance, or its ISO 8601 representation if the original value is not available. This method checks the `origval` property, which stores the input JSON string during initialization. If `origval` is not None, it is returned directly; otherwise, the method returns the standardized ISO 8601 string representation of the date via the `isostring` property. The `isostring` property normalizes the date by converting partial dates to complete ones (e.g., "2024" becomes "2024-01-01"), ensuring compatibility with Python's `datetime` functionalities.

FHIRAbstractBase.as_json.docstring:
Serializes the properties of the FHIRAbstractBase instance to a JSON-compatible dictionary. This method uses the `elementProperties()` to gather metadata about the properties, including their names, types, and whether they are required. 

It ensures that:
- All required properties are present and not None, with lists being non-empty.
- The types of properties match the expected types as defined in `elementProperties()`.

If any validation errors occur (such as incorrect types or missing required fields), it raises a `FHIRValidationError` with detailed information about the errors encountered.

Returns:
    dict: A validated dictionary that can be directly serialized to JSON.

Raises:
    FHIRValidationError: If property types are incorrect or any required properties are missing.

Dependencies:
    - Calls `elementProperties()` to retrieve metadata about the instance's properties.
    - Uses the `_matches_type()` method to validate property types.
    - Utilizes the `FHIRValidationError` class to report validation issues.

def __init__(self, jsonval: Union[str, None]=None):
        """Initialize a new instance of the FHIRInstant class, which is designed to work with FHIR instants in Python.

Parameters:
- jsonval (Union[str, None]): A string representation of the FHIR instant or None. This value is passed to the parent class (FHIRDate) for initialization. 

Attributes:
- datetime (Union[datetime.datetime, None]): Holds a Python datetime representation of the FHIR instant. Initialized as None.

This constructor calls the parent class's initializer, allowing it to process the provided jsonval. The FHIRInstant class inherits functionality from FHIRDate, which includes parsing the JSON value and ensuring compatibility with FHIR's instant data type."""
        self.datetime: Union[datetime.datetime, None] = None
        super().__init__(jsonval)

FHIRAbstractResource.as_json.code:
def as_json(self):
        """Generate a JSON representation of the FHIR resource, including its resource type.

Returns a dictionary representation of the instance by calling the superclass's `as_json()` method and adding a 'resourceType' entry, which indicates the type of the FHIR resource defined by the `resource_type` class attribute. This class attribute is defined in the `FHIRAbstractResource` class and is essential for correctly identifying the resource type when serialized to JSON.

Returns:
    dict: A JSON-compatible dictionary representing the FHIR resource, including the 'resourceType'."""
        js = super(FHIRAbstractResource, self).as_json()
        js['resourceType'] = self.resource_type
        return js

def __init__(self, jsondict=None, strict=True):
        """Initialize a DomainResource instance, which represents a FHIR resource that can contain narrative text, extensions, and other resources. 

Parameters:
- jsondict (dict, optional): A dictionary containing initial values for the resource properties. Defaults to None.
- strict (bool, optional): If True, raises FHIRValidationError for invalid variables; defaults to True.

Attributes initialized:
- contained: Represents inline resources contained within the main resource.
- extension: Represents additional content defined by implementations, allowing customization.
- modifierExtension: Similar to extensions but indicates that these cannot be ignored in processing.
- text: A human-readable summary of the resource's content.

This constructor calls the parent class's initializer (resource.Resource) to ensure proper setup."""
        ' Initialize all valid properties.\n        \n        :raises: FHIRValidationError on validation errors, unless strict is False\n        :param dict jsondict: A JSON dictionary to use for initialization\n        :param bool strict: If True (the default), invalid variables will raise a TypeError\n        '
        self.contained = None
        ' Contained, inline Resources.\n        List of `Resource` items (represented as `dict` in JSON). '
        self.extension = None
        ' Additional content defined by implementations.\n        List of `Extension` items (represented as `dict` in JSON). '
        self.modifierExtension = None
        ' Extensions that cannot be ignored.\n        List of `Extension` items (represented as `dict` in JSON). '
        self.text = None
        ' Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation.\n        Type `Narrative` (represented as `dict` in JSON). '
        super(DomainResource, self).__init__(jsondict=jsondict, strict=strict)

        Type `str`. """

        """ A set of rules under which this content was created.
        Type `str`. """
        
        self.language = None
        """ Language of the resource content.
        Type `str`. """
        
        self.meta = None
        """ Metadata about the resource.
        Type `Meta` (represented as `dict` in JSON). """

# IMPLEMENTATION REQUIREMENTS:
## MODULE DESCRIPTION:
The FHIR Slot Testing Module facilitates the validation and verification of FHIR-compliant Slot resources, ensuring accurate representation and adherence to the HL7 FHIR standard (v4.0.1). Its primary purpose is to test Slot resources, which represent time intervals that healthcare services are available or unavailable, by instantiating, serializing, and comparing test data against expected outcomes. The module supports evaluating key attributes such as appointment types, statuses (e.g., free, busy, tentative), service categories, and associated time intervals, enabling developers to confirm that Slot resources are correctly implemented and functional. This capability ensures robustness in applications that rely on the accurate scheduling and availability of healthcare services, addressing the need for reliable data interoperability in health IT systems.

## FILE 1: fhirclient/models/slot.py

- CLASS METHOD: Slot.__init__
  - CLASS SIGNATURE: class Slot(domainresource.DomainResource):
  - SIGNATURE: def __init__(self, jsondict=None, strict=True):
  - DOCSTRING: 
```python
"""
Initialize all valid properties for the Slot instance, which represents a time slot available for booking appointments. 

Parameters:
- jsondict (dict, optional): A JSON dictionary containing values to initialize the Slot properties. If not provided, all properties are set to None.
- strict (bool, optional): If True (default), raises a FHIRValidationError on validation errors; if False, invalid variables will not raise an error.

Attributes:
- appointmentType (CodeableConcept): Type of appointment or patient that may be booked.
- comment (str): Additional comments about the slot.
- end (FHIRInstant): Date and time when the slot ends.
- identifier (list of Identifier): External IDs for the slot.
- overbooked (bool): Indicates if the slot is overbooked.
- schedule (FHIRReference): Reference to the schedule this slot belongs to.
- serviceCategory (list of CodeableConcept): Broad categorization of the service.
- serviceType (list of CodeableConcept): Identifiable service type for appointments.
- specialty (list of CodeableConcept): Required specialty for the requested service.
- start (FHIRInstant): Date and time when the slot begins.
- status (str): Current status of the slot (e.g., busy, free).

Notes:
This class extends the DomainResource class, using its initialization method to populate common properties. The attributes are set to their respective types as defined in the FHIR specifications, facilitating adherence to health information standards.
"""
```

## FILE 2: fhirclient/models/fhirdate.py

- CLASS METHOD: FHIRDate.__init__
  - CLASS SIGNATURE: class FHIRDate:
  - SIGNATURE: def __init__(self, jsonval: Union[str, None]=None):
  - DOCSTRING: 
```python
"""
Initialize a FHIRDate instance to facilitate working with FHIR-compliant date strings.

Parameters:
- jsonval (Union[str, None]): A FHIR-compliant date string (in ISO 8601 format) or None. If provided, it must be a string that matches the expected FHIR date format as validated by the class-level regex constant `_REGEX`. 

Raises:
- TypeError: If `jsonval` is not a string when provided.
- ValueError: If `jsonval` does not match the expected date format.

Attributes:
- date (Union[datetime.date, datetime.datetime, datetime.time, None]): Represents the parsed date from `jsonval` or None if no valid date is provided.
- origval (Union[str, None]): Stores the original input string `jsonval` for reference when generating JSON outputs.

The class relies on the `_REGEX` constant for format validation and `_from_string` method for parsing the FHIR date string into a Python date object. If `jsonval` is a valid FHIR date string, it is converted and stored in the `date` attribute; otherwise, the instance is constructed with `None` values.
"""
```

- CLASS METHOD: FHIRDate.as_json
  - CLASS SIGNATURE: class FHIRDate:
  - SIGNATURE: def as_json(self) -> Union[str, None]:
  - DOCSTRING: 
```python
"""
Returns the original JSON string used to create the FHIRDate instance, or its ISO 8601 representation if the original value is not available. This method checks the `origval` property, which stores the input JSON string during initialization. If `origval` is not None, it is returned directly; otherwise, the method returns the standardized ISO 8601 string representation of the date via the `isostring` property. The `isostring` property normalizes the date by converting partial dates to complete ones (e.g., "2024" becomes "2024-01-01"), ensuring compatibility with Python's `datetime` functionalities.
"""
```

- CLASS METHOD: FHIRDate.__setattr__
  - CLASS SIGNATURE: class FHIRDate:
  - SIGNATURE: def __setattr__(self, prop, value):
  - DOCSTRING: 
```python
"""
Sets attributes for the FHIRDate instance, with special handling for the `date` property. 

Parameters:
- `prop`: The name of the attribute to set.
- `value`: The value to assign to the specified attribute.

If the attribute being set is either 'date' or the internal `_FIELD` constant (which is also set to 'date'), the method clears the `origval` attribute and ensures synchronization between the `date` property and the internal representation of that property. For all other attributes, it sets them normally.

This method maintains the integrity of the date field within the FHIRDate class and ensures that changes to the date representation are accurately reflected without retaining the original JSON value used for initialization.
"""
```

```python
"""
Serializes the properties of the FHIRAbstractBase instance to a JSON-compatible dictionary. This method uses the `elementProperties()` to gather metadata about the properties, including their names, types, and whether they are required. 

It ensures that:
- All required properties are present and not None, with lists being non-empty.
- The types of properties match the expected types as defined in `elementProperties()`.

If any validation errors occur (such as incorrect types or missing required fields), it raises a `FHIRValidationError` with detailed information about the errors encountered.

Returns:
    dict: A validated dictionary that can be directly serialized to JSON.

Raises:
    FHIRValidationError: If property types are incorrect or any required properties are missing.

Dependencies:
    - Calls `elementProperties()` to retrieve metadata about the instance's properties.
    - Uses the `_matches_type()` method to validate property types.
    - Utilizes the `FHIRValidationError` class to report validation issues.
"""
```

from . import domainresource

class Slot(domainresource.DomainResource):
    """ A slot of time on a schedule that may be available for booking appointments.
    """
    resource_type = 'Slot'

    def elementProperties(self):
        js = super(Slot, self).elementProperties()
        js.extend([('appointmentType', 'appointmentType', codeableconcept.CodeableConcept, False, None, False), ('comment', 'comment', str, False, None, False), ('end', 'end', fhirinstant.FHIRInstant, False, None, True), ('identifier', 'identifier', identifier.Identifier, True, None, False), ('overbooked', 'overbooked', bool, False, None, False), ('schedule', 'schedule', fhirreference.FHIRReference, False, None, True), ('serviceCategory', 'serviceCategory', codeableconcept.CodeableConcept, True, None, False), ('serviceType', 'serviceType', codeableconcept.CodeableConcept, True, None, False), ('specialty', 'specialty', codeableconcept.CodeableConcept, True, None, False), ('start', 'start', fhirinstant.FHIRInstant, False, None, True), ('status', 'status', str, False, None, True)])
        return js

file_code.fhirclient/models/fhirinstant.py:
"""Facilitate working with FHIR time fields."""
import datetime
import re
from typing import Any, Union
from .fhirdate import FHIRDate

class FHIRInstant(FHIRDate):
    """
    A convenience class for working with FHIR instants in Python.

    http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#instant

    Converting to a Python representation does require some compromises:
    - FHIR allows arbitrary sub-second precision, but Python only holds microseconds.
    - Leap seconds (:60) will be changed to the 59th second (:59) because Python's time classes
      do not support leap seconds.

    If such compromise is not useful for you, avoid using the `date`, `datetime`, or `isostring`
    properties and just use the `as_json()` method in order to work with the original,
    exact string.

    Public properties:
    - `datetime`: datetime.datetime representing the JSON value (aware only)
    - `date`: backwards-compatibility alias for `datetime`
    - `isostring`: an ISO 8601 string version of the above Python object

    Public methods:
    - `as_json`: returns the original JSON used to construct the instance
    """
    _REGEX = re.compile('([0-9]([0-9]([0-9][1-9]|[1-9]0)|[1-9]00)|[1-9]000)-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[1-2][0-9]|3[0-1])T([01][0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]:([0-5][0-9]|60)(\\.[0-9]+)?(Z|(\\+|-)((0[0-9]|1[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]|14:00))')
    _FIELD = 'datetime'

    @staticmethod
    def _from_string(value: str) -> Any:
        return FHIRDate._parse_datetime(value)

from . import resource

class DomainResource(resource.Resource):
    """ A resource with narrative, extensions, and contained resources.
    
    A resource that includes narrative, extensions, and contained resources.
    """
    resource_type = 'DomainResource'

    def elementProperties(self):
        js = super(DomainResource, self).elementProperties()
        js.extend([('contained', 'contained', resource.Resource, True, None, False), ('extension', 'extension', extension.Extension, True, None, False), ('modifierExtension', 'modifierExtension', extension.Extension, True, None, False), ('text', 'text', narrative.Narrative, False, None, False)])
        return js
from . import extension
from . import narrative
